# init()

**Initializer**

Creates a default stage-utilization result.

## Declaration

```swift
init()
```

## Discussion

Metal creates [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCounterResultStageUtilization] instances for you when you resolve the counter set’s data (see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/converting-a-gpus-counter-data-into-a-readable-format]). There’s no reason for you to manually create one in your app.

## Swift support

- **init(totalCycles:vertexCycles:tessellationCycles:postTessellationVertexCycles:fragmentCycles:renderTargetCycles:)**: Creates a stage-utilization result from utilization values.
